problem_text:
Let G be a simple algebraic group over an algebraically closed field of characteristic p and G be the Lie algebra of G. Is the number of orbits of nilpotent elements of G under the adjoint action of G finite? This is known to be true if p is not too small (i. e. if p is not a “bad prime” for G).
R. W. Carter
answer: Yes, it is (D. F. Holt, N. Spaltenstein, J. Austral. Math. Soc. (A), 38 (1985), 330–350).
